result.execSummary:
The defendant Zackary J Kwitek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Handgun-Alcohol Sold/Consumed, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.237(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: to any other probation.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescriptions must be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No contact with any of the Victims or Witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Not to use or possess any firearms during the period of probation.  Take a Firearms safety course.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zackary J Kwitek

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Zackary J Kwitek in court with attorney Daniel C. Nedset.   
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to both counts 3 & 4.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 3 & 4.
Counts 1 & 2 are dismissed as read ins.
Defendant made a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
COUNT:  3
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  12 Months
Concurrent to: Any other probation.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  any of the Victims or Witnesses listed in the complaint.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Not to use or possess any firearms during the period of probation.
Take a Firearms safety course.

COSTS:  $243
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $ 200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


COUNT:  4
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  12 Months.
Concurrent to: Any other probation.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as count 3.

CONDITION TIME:
15 Days Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Defendant to report to the main jail by 6 pm. on 08/05/2022.

COSTS:  $243
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $ 200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Court will order the firearm seized forfieted and can be destroyed pursuant to statute by the holding law enforcement agency.
2 Character Letters filed on behalf of the defendant.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
File not called on the record.
Attorney Daniel C. Nedset in court.   
Defendant Zackary J Kwitek did not appear.   
Attorney appeared by authorization previously filed.

Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Letter from Attorney Nedset requesting adjournment of hearing scheduled for 4/29/2022.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 4/21/2022 - Granted, hearing to be rescheduled.**

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  When victim key is recieved defendant to have no contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

08:46 AM Defendant Zackary J Kwitek in court with attorney Adam Kachelski for attorney Daniel C. Nedset.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Staet will need to file a victim key.  Hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
